channel.title: TECHNOLOGY on Yuzhen Li's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in TECHNOLOGY on Yuzhen Li's Blog

item.title: Mastering SQL Window Functions: A Comprehensive Guide
item.description: SQL window functions are one of the most powerful and flexible tools available to analysts and developers. They allow for sophisticated calculations across rows of data while preserving the individual rows, which makes them ideal for a wide range of use cases, from ranking and cumulative sums to moving averages and comparisons.

item.title: A SQL Practical Challenge on Salary Analysis
item.description: Recently, I encountered an interesting SQL challenge. The task required using window functions to analyze employee salaries within departments. This is a powerful yet sometimes tricky feature in SQL. Here is the problem description and how I solved it.

item.title: Build a Personal Blog—1. Install Hugo, Git, Configure the Blowfish Theme
item.description: Why Rebuild # Recently, I’ve been preparing for the AWS SAA exam and learning new technologies through side projects. I want to document this journey. Since all the previous blog files were on an old computer in China and the GitHub repository only had public content, I decided to restart my blog as a way to practice writing and keep records.

item.title: Build a Personal Blog—2. Customizing the Blowfish Theme
item.description: 1. Site Configuration # After copying the exampleSite folder, the site directory structure becomes as follows: my-site/ ├── archetypes/ │ └── default.md ├── assets/

item.title: Build a Personal Blog—3. Deploying with GitHub Pages
item.description: We aim to host the static website generated by Hugo using GitHub Pages service, which allows us to avoid maintaining our own server and ensures more stability and security. Therefore, we need to upload the static web files generated by Hugo to the GitHub Pages repository.

item.title: Build a Personal Blog—4. How to Bind a Custom Domain to Your GitHub Pages Blog
item.description: Deploying a personal blog on GitHub Pages has been up and running for some time now, and I have been using the default domain username.github.io. Recently, I finally purchased a 10-year domain on Tencent Cloud for less than 10 pounds.

item.title: Problem solving——Local commits to GitHub repositories, contributions not shown
item.description: Problem Description # Recently, I’ve been using GitHub to configure and update my blog. However, today I noticed that my contributions are not being recorded on GitHub, and the commit history in the repository shows the following:
